column4: does ubuntu supply libs with their mingw32 packages?  Is this the correct channel to ask this?
Flare_laptop: where because within my /usr/i586-mingw32msvc directory I'm not finding a pkgconfig or sys-root directory!
Flare_Laptop: I'm wondering if this might not be the correct channel to ask this
mingw32 is a windows library
Yes I'm trying to cross compile
Yes I'm trying to cross compile Handbrake
first and formost you need the cross compiler version of gcc
Doesnt mingw provide this?
though since you are using the same processor (ix86) it is mostly for setting some parameters
mingw32 is a minimal gcc environment for windows
as such it doesn't cross compile
but, if I understand you correctly you want to PORT a linux app Handbrake to Windows?
yes
cross compile -- which they have some instructions on the Handbrake site how to do -- but it seems mingw32 installed from repository doesn't come with a full set of libraries on ubuntu
a cross compile is translating from one processor arcitecture to another
you are PORTing software..
